channel.title: Richard Taylor's Threads
channel.description: Series of articles by Richard Taylor BEng PhD

item.title: HTTPS and Observability
item.description: Why the API has to be HTTPS and some other basics for service observability.

item.title: Simple Searches
item.description: Adding the most basic search functionality to The Electric Cat so that we can find what we already made.

item.title: Links and Refactoring the Models
item.description: Adding a /v1/links endpoint highlights a few areas where the API and DataModels modules need refactoring.

item.title: Users, Tokens and Event Logging
item.description: To log all events of who did what, we first have to sort out who is who; by nailing down our user management.

item.title: Test Driven Refinement
item.description: After knocking about ideas for the basic API, the next thing to do is solidify the design by adding more tests to prove it out.

item.title: Null Safe Boundaries
item.description: A look at how null objects crop up in programs and how to design them out of your own code.

item.title: RSS Is Alive And Well
item.description: A look at why I added RSS support to the threader, why I think RSS is still important, and why you should too.
